bug.author: sl1pkn07
bug.summary: python build (with cython) seems broken in linux (python3)
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
python setup.py --with-cython seems broken on linux <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info (Required)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>└───╼ python diagnose.py ----------Python Info---------- Version : 3.6.5 Compiler : GCC 7.3.1 20180406 Build : ('default', 'Apr 14 2018 13:17:30') Arch : ('64bit', 'ELF') ------------Pip Info----------- Version : 9.0.1 Directory : /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pip ----------MXNet Info----------- No MXNet installed. ----------System Info---------- Platform : Linux-4.16.4-1-ARCH-x86_64-with-arch system : Linux node : sL1pKn07 release : 4.16.4-1-ARCH version : #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue Apr 24 13:21:29 UTC 2018 ----------Hardware Info---------- machine : x86_64 processor : Arquitectura: x86_64 modo(s) de operación de las CPUs: 32-bit, 64-bit Orden de los bytes: Little Endian CPU(s): 48 Lista de la(s) CPU(s) en línea: 0-47 Hilo(s) de procesamiento por núcleo: 2 Núcleo(s) por «socket»: 12 «Socket(s)» 2 Modo(s) NUMA: 2 ID de fabricante: GenuineIntel Familia de CPU: 6 Modelo: 79 Nombre del modelo: Genuine Intel(R) CPU 0000 @ 2.20GHz Revisión: 0 CPU MHz: 1988.153 CPU MHz máx.: 2400,0000 CPU MHz mín.: 1200,0000 BogoMIPS: 4392.39 Virtualización: VT-x Caché L1d: 32K Caché L1i: 32K Caché L2: 256K Caché L3: 30720K CPU(s) del nodo NUMA 0: 0-11,24-35 CPU(s) del nodo NUMA 1: 12-23,36-47 Indicadores: fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ss ht tm pbe syscall nx pdpe1gb rdtscp lm constant_tsc arch_perfmon pebs bts rep_good nopl xtopology nonstop_tsc cpuid aperfmperf pni pclmulqdq dtes64 monitor ds_cpl vmx smx est tm2 ssse3 sdbg fma cx16 xtpr pdcm pcid dca sse4_1 sse4_2 x2apic movbe popcnt aes xsave avx f16c rdrand lahf_lm abm 3dnowprefetch cpuid_fault epb cat_l3 cdp_l3 invpcid_single pti intel_ppin tpr_shadow vnmi flexpriority ept vpid fsgsbase tsc_adjust bmi1 hle avx2 smep bmi2 erms invpcid rtm cqm rdt_a rdseed adx smap intel_pt xsaveopt cqm_llc cqm_occup_llc cqm_mbm_total cqm_mbm_local dtherm ida arat pln pts ----------Network Test---------- Setting timeout: 10 Timing for MXNet: https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet, DNS: 0.0245 sec, LOAD: 1.0120 sec. Timing for Gluon Tutorial(en): http://gluon.mxnet.io, DNS: 0.2953 sec, LOAD: 0.0879 sec. Timing for Gluon Tutorial(cn): https://zh.gluon.ai, DNS: 0.2812 sec, LOAD: 0.8269 sec. Timing for FashionMNIST: https://apache-mxnet.s3-accelerate.dualstack.amazonaws.com/gluon/dataset/fashion-mnist/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz, DNS: 0.1800 sec, LOAD: 0.8772 sec. Timing for PYPI: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pip, DNS: 0.0218 sec, LOAD: 0.6655 sec. Timing for Conda: https://repo.continuum.io/pkgs/free/, DNS: 0.2025 sec, LOAD: 0.9752 sec.
</denchmark-code>
Package used (Python/R/Scala/Julia): python 3.6 cython (builded with python3) 0.28.2 Compiler (gcc/clang/mingw/visual studio): MXNet commit hash: f0d2776bb9bb3c4f164f1704f0ca3e2b28952c0f Build config: cmake ../incubator-mxnet -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=None -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr -DCMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR=lib -DCMAKE_INSTALL_DOCDIR=share/doc/mxnet -DCUDA_HOST_COMPILER=/opt/cuda/bin/gcc -DCUDA_CUDA_LIBRARY=/opt/cuda/lib64/stub/libcuda.so -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF -DBUILD_CPP_EXAMPLES=OFF -DUSE_CPP_PACKAGE=ON -DUSE_OLDCMAKECUDA=ON -DUSE_CUDNN=ON -DUSE_NCCL=ON -DUSE_OPENCV=ON -DUSE_OPENMP=ON -DUSE_LAPACK=ON -DUSE_JEMALLOC=OFF -DUSE_GPERFTOOLS=OFF -DWITH_EXAMPLE=OFF -DWITH_TEST=OFF \ <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Compiling mxnet/cython/symbol.pyx because it changed. Compiling mxnet/cython/ndarray.pyx because it changed. [1/2] Cythonizing mxnet/cython/ndarray.pyx
Error compiling Cython file: ------------------------------------------------------------ ... # Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one ^ ------------------------------------------------------------
mxnet/cython/ndarray.pyx:1:0: 'mxnet/_cy3/.ndarray' is not a valid module name Traceback (most recent call last): File "setup.py", line 107, in <module> ext_modules=config_cython(), File "setup.py", line 96, in config_cython return cythonize(ret) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1026, in cythonize cythonize_one(*args) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1146, in cythonize_one raise CompileError(None, pyx_file) Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: mxnet/cython/ndarray.pyx </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Minimum reproducible example</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
MXNET_LIBRARY_PATH="${pkgdir}/usr/lib/libmxnet.so" python setup.py install --root="${pkgdir}"/ --optimize=1 --with-cython <denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
archlinux [AUR] mxnet package fix with use this: <denchmark-link:https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/PKGBUILD?h=mxnet#n47>https://aur.archlinux.org/cgit/aur.git/tree/PKGBUILD?h=mxnet#n47</denchmark-link>
but i'm not sure if is ok

comments.comment: The same with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/10295>#10295</denchmark-link> . The problem is with cython 0.28. It is ok with 0.27.

It seems this issue has been fixed by Open [MXNET-545] Fix broken cython build <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/10951>#10951</denchmark-link> .<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sl1pkn07>@sl1pkn07</denchmark-link> Could you please verify it? Thx!

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apeforest>@apeforest</denchmark-link> i cant test the PR because i cant apply it in the top of master (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commit/7aac0b52539361415c3ba74e9e0de99c05813d4b>7aac0b5</denchmark-link> ) greetings
Throwing same error with the latest "cython-0.29.6". Tried uninstalling cython, and then try to install again(pip version), but it's throwing same issue.

This issue may have been fixed in the latest master. Would you check the latest master? Also see <denchmark-link:https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/master/faq/env_var.html#interface-between-python-and-the-c-api>this FAQ entry</denchmark-link> .

I have tried with latest master on Ubuntu EC2 instance and it's working for me. Below is the sample output: Using /home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/python3/lib/python3.6/site-packages Finished processing dependencies for mxnet==1.5.0 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sl1pkn07>@sl1pkn07</denchmark-link> Could you please try it again and see if it's failing for you or not and we can close this issue if it's not reproducible. Thanks!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/karan6181>@karan6181</denchmark-link> Would you check if the cython modules are actually used in runtime? should be or .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/asitstands>@asitstands</denchmark-link> Yes absolutely. Could you please provide me the steps to do that? I did something like this: export MXNET_ENABLE_CYTHON=1 make -j $(nproc) cd python pip install -e . python setup.py install --with-cython

import mxnet as mx print(mx.nd._internal.NDArrayBase) <denchmark-link:https://github.com/karan6181>@karan6181</denchmark-link> This would be enough to see whether the cython modules are actually used in runtime. If it prints or , the cython modules are used. If it prints , there may be something wrong with the cython modules.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/asitstands>@asitstands</denchmark-link> Thanks for the information. I can see the cython module being loaded correctly. Below is the output: Python 3.7.3 (default, Mar 27 2019, 22:11:17) [GCC 7.3.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import mxnet as mx >>> print(mx.nd._internal.NDArrayBase) <class 'mxnet._cy3.ndarray.NDArrayBase'>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nswamy>@nswamy</denchmark-link> Could you please close this issue? Thanks!

The PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/10951>#10951</denchmark-link> fixed this issue. We are closing it for now. Please feel free to re-open it if you are still facing the issue. Thanks!
